1566288245_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body: If You intend to archive material, then I suggest that You use NilFS file system and mount the hard-disk in readonly mode. The NilFS is not suitable for multiuser scenarios, where the file system is mounted with write permission, because in those scenarios it, supposedly, has a security flaw that one user can access the files of another user. However, the NilFS never corrupts, to the extent that there is no fsck-tool for it, because that tool is just NOT NEEDED BY DESIGN. If You need write-access, want to run some P2P-system, then I suggest the ReiserFS. Yes, the original author, the Reiser, murdered his wife, but the ReiserFS is a collective effort and the tech is really good. It helps, if there is a root cron job that runs the sync command line tool every minute.
